description.narrative: To assist the Borrower in (i): improving access to potable water for the participating communities; and (ii) improving hygiene, sanitation and water-related practices at individual, family and institutional levels in the rural areas, and (iii) strengthening the institutional framework and capacity for the rural drinking water supply and sanitation sector.

condition.narrative: ARIS to submit project audits for the year ended June

title.narrative: Average tariff collection rate in villages served by the project

comment.narrative: Baseline taken ahead of commencement of works

title.narrative: Percentage of people reporting using soap for washing hands before food preparation/washing children’s hands

comment.narrative: Indicator measured in project areas.

title.narrative: Reduction in incidence of waterborne illnesses [acute intestinal infections and hepatitis A] in communities that participate in theproject

comment.narrative: Indicator moved from PDO to IO. ARIS is collecting the baseline data from the local medical registry. The definition of theindicator is also revised because it can be measured on waterborne diseases for which data is recorded at the village level, andthese are hepatitis A and acute intestinal infections, only.

Cases of acute intestinal infections in 2012 - 428; Hepatitis A - 228 in target villages. Data for 6 months of 2014 shows thatthere are 126 cases of acute intestinal infection, and 69 of Hepatitis A. Total decrease ia about 62.5% (data for the half of 2012in comparison for data for half of 2014)

title.narrative: Percentage of households in the service area of the rehabilitated schemes reporting distance to the nearest improved water source at 500/1000 meters or less

comment.narrative: Moved from PDO, “35” is removed to allow flexibility on number of schemes.

title.narrative: Number of people in rural areas provided with access to improved water supply service under the project

comment.narrative: New “custom” indicator introduced to count beneficiaries of rehabilitations.
Current number of beneficiaries for 29 completed schemes. Beneficiaries in remaining ongoing 8 schemes (20 villages) not yetaccounted (expected to exceed target).

title.narrative: State WSS strategy endorsed by the Government

comment.narrative: This indicator is taken up from intermediate outcome indicators measure outcomes of Component C.
approved and signed by Prime Minister on September 24, 2014.

title.narrative: Percentage of people reporting using soap for washing hands after using toilet, in communities that participate in the project

comment.narrative: This indicator is taken up from intermediate outcome indicators to measure outcomes of Component B.

In average in three oblasts the indicator increased by 12.7%. In Issuk-Kul oblast from 80% to 91%, in Talas oblast form 41% to49%,and in Naryn oblast from 66% to 85%, as of November 2013 and July 2014, respectively .

title.narrative: Number of equipment procured for operation and maintenance of the schemes

comment.narrative: Revised by reducing end target from 100 to 10 because due to the project limited budget, priority is given to completion of civilworks over purchase of equipment.
97 units of equipment will be provided to CDWUUs by the end of October (7 excavators, 30 tricycles, and 60 sets of maintenanceequipment)

title.narrative: Number of schools with hand-washing facilities in use with soap and water available near latrines, in communities that participate in the project

comment.narrative: Harmonized with intermediate outcome 009 (near latrines). Target set at 35 (taken from 009, instead of 100 because it is measuredin project areas).
Different types of hand-washing facilities are installed in 52 schools.

title.narrative: Piped household water connections that are benefiting from rehabilitation works undertaken by the project

comment.narrative: Revised by setting the target at 1000.
In completed 27 schemes. 8 more schemes are at the final stage of completion.

title.narrative: Number of water supply schemes rehabilitated by the project

comment.narrative: Total number of schemes will be 37 instead of 35, as 2 schemes were split into 4.

title.narrative: People trained to improve hygiene behavior/sanitation practices under the proj

comment.narrative: including 74% of females

title.narrative: Number of villages with information on water supply and sanitation included in the national database

comment.narrative: the consultant is preparing a software part of the database and GIS interface

title.narrative: Improved community water points constructed or rehabilitated under the project

comment.narrative: Revised by setting the target at 226. No more water points are envisaged for the rest of the project.

title.narrative: Number of CDWUU staff trained in fee collection and management of the water and sanitation schemes

comment.narrative: Revised by specifying in the wording of the indicator that it is "staff" of CDWUUs and not CDWUUs that are being trained.

title.narrative: Number of water utilities that the project is supporting

comment.narrative: In the case of RWSSP2 a utility is a CDWUU.

title.narrative: Number of CDWUUs service agreements signed
New piped household water connections that are resulting from the project intervention

comment.narrative: Revised by setting the target at 2000.

title.narrative: Number of schools in the project area with a functioning water supply connection as a result of the project

comment.narrative: Wording clarified.

title.narrative: Percentage of CDWUUs supported by the project with a woman holding one of the three most senior positions

comment.narrative: Revised by clarifying the wording: data is measured only in CDWUUs supported by the project. Accordingly, the target is alsoclarified and fixed at 45%.

title.narrative: Average level of Operation and Maintenance cost recovered by utilities targeted by the project

comment.narrative: Revised by adding the word "average" to the definition of the indicator.

title.narrative: Percentage of water quality tests in the service area of the rehabilitated schemes that meet national standards for drinking water

comment.narrative: “35” is removed to allow flexibility on the number of schemes. Also “SES” is removed given that test may have to be carried outdirectly by the project if SES does not perform water analysis in the target villages.

title.narrative: Improved latrines constructed under the project

comment.narrative: 10 toilets are being newly constructed and 8 - rehabilitated. In total 18 toilets will be improved by the end of the project.

title.narrative: People provided with access to “improved sanitation facilities”- rural

comment.narrative: Revised by setting the target at 5000.

New construction/ reconstruction works are being completed in 18 schools. Total number of pupils in these schools is 9,151.Moreover, as a result of project interventions on campaigns on sanitation and hygiene, 2,178 households have already improved theirtoiletsat own cost (or 10.5% of total target population). Total number of people in 2,178 households is roughly 10,000 people.

title.narrative: People provided with access to "improved sanitation facilities” under the proj.

comment.narrative: Revised by setting the target at 5000.

New construction/ reconstruction works are being completed in 18 schools. Total number of pupils in these schools is9,151.Moreover, as a result of project interventions on campaigns on sanitation and hygiene, 2,178 households have improved theirtoilets at own cost (or 10.5% of total target population). Total number of people in 2,178 households is roughly 10,000 people.

title.narrative: People trained to improve hygiene behavior/sanitation practices - female
